cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 395 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida

motion.direction: N (expected to turn NNE then NE)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to accelerate northeast, crossing the Florida Big Bend Thursday, then moving inland over Georgia/Carolinas and emerging off the Mid-Atlantic coast late Saturday–Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Indian Pass–Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Marineland FL to Altamaha Sound GA (Tropical Storm Watch); Anclote River FL to Indian Pass FL (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Anclote River FL to Walton/Bay County line FL (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida Thursday, then Atlantic coast from Georgia through the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic this weekend
weather_observation.wind: Low (≈15%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; if they occur, gusts 30–40 mph possible Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Delaware Bay for this event
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Sunday–Monday as the system passes offshore
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Delaware beaches beginning late Saturday
